events.title: ‘Tarcol’ was formed from troops of 20 Indian Division to drive the enemy from the Myoth
events.description: 53. Myothit-Thaungdut Area. On _ the 10th August “Tarcol”, a special force of two battalions and a detachment of engineers, was formed from troops of 20 Indian Division to drive the enemy from the Myothit Thaungdut area.

events.title: Japan's surrender was broadcast from Tokio on 10th August, and the acceptance of the Allied terms on 14
events.description: 322. From these momentous events, and faced with certain Allied invasion of the homeland, for which air power had paved the way, Japan could see no escape. The end came in the form of surrender, which was broadcast from Tokio on 10th August, and the acceptance of the Allied terms on 14th August.
